intro: Ceraia tridentata, commonly known as the three-toothed ceraia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, each leaflet having a distinct toothed edge. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
